intro: Holigarna beddomei, commonly known as the Beddome's holigarna, is a rare and unique plant species native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often growing in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and small, inconspicuous fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered an endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
